questions.question: 1. A/an ________ signal is a continuously varying electromagnetic wave that may be propagated over a variety of media, depending on spectrum. Examples are wire media and fiber optic cable.

options.a: Digital.
options.b: Analog.
options.c: Periodic.
options.d: Asynchronous.

questions.question: 2. A key parameter that characterizes any electromagnetic signal is ________, which is the width of the range of frequencies that comprises the signal.

options.a: Wavelength.
options.b: Fundamental frequency.
options.c: Bandwidth.
options.d: None of these.

questions.question: 3. Signal attenuation (in unguided mediums) increases with _______ for the same distance.

options.a: Lower frequencies.
options.b: Higher frequencies.
options.c: Multiplexing several channels on the same medium.
options.d: Nothing.

questions.question: 4. In ________, the signal reflect/refract on higher ionized layer of Earth's atmosphere and on surface, allowing it to travel great distances by going back and forth in hops.

options.a: Ground propagation.
options.b: Ionosphere reflection.
options.c: Troposphere scattering.
options.d: Satellite transmission.

questions.question: 5. To get less errors while maintaining the same bandwidth of the transmission, you should ______.

options.a: Increase the Eb /N0.
options.b: Decrease the Eb /N0.
options.c: Increase the data rate (R).
options.d: Change the transmission medium.

questions.question: 6. In practical transmission systems, the calculation of the path loss uses a "correction" factor that counts for the _______.

options.a: Environment (e.g., in-buildings, urban area, etc.) and channel conditions (e.g., multipath distortion, crosstalk, scattering, etc.)
options.b: Wavelength of the carrier signal.
options.c: Distance between the transmitter and receiver.
options.d: Thermal Noise.

questions.question: 7. A differential signal encoding is _________.

options.a: When data are represented by differential equations.
options.b: When data changes discreetly in time between pre-defined levels.
options.c: When data are represented by changes rather than values (levels).
options.d: When data continuously changes between positive and negative levels.

questions.question: 8. Nyquist rate is ______.

options.a: The maximum channel capacity, given the SNR of the signal.
options.b: The minimum required sampling rate of an analog signal, at which it can be retrieved back to its original format without errors.
options.c: The same as the modulation rate but for analog signals.
options.d: None of those.

options.a: Every symbol will be represented by several bits in the transmitted signal.
options.b: The data is MUXed over frequency to allow several uses to access the same transmission medium.
options.c: Every user will have his own user code that is used to spread-spectrum his transmission over the entire bandwidth.
options.d: Symbols (or bits) will be transmitted by hopping between frequencies based on a spreading code.

questions.question: 10. Traditionally, ______ is used alongside FHSS.

options.a: MPSK.
options.b: MFSK.
options.c: QAM.
options.d: ASK.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using Frequency Hopping Spread Spectrum (FHSS) in communications?

options.a: To reduce the transmission power required
options.b: To increase the data rate of transmission
options.c: To enhance security by making signals more difficult to intercept and jam
options.d: To simplify the protocol requirements

questions.question: How does the Hamming Code ensure error detection and correction?

options.a: By using parity bits to check the integrity of data segments
options.b: By encoding data using a minimum distance of 3
options.c: By transmitting data without any additional bits
options.d: By increasing the bandwidth of the transmission

questions.question: In polynomial division for CRC, what is typically the result of dividing message polynomial f(X) by generator polynomial g(X)?

options.a: The quotient represents the original data
options.b: The remainder becomes the CRC
options.c: The generator polynomial is modified
options.d: The message polynomial remains unchanged

questions.question: What is the impact of frame size on the efficiency of the Stop-and-Wait ARQ protocol?

options.a: Larger frame sizes generally increase the efficiency
options.b: Frame size has no impact on the efficiency
options.c: Smaller frame sizes improve the error detection capability
options.d: Larger frame sizes decrease the bandwidth utilization

questions.question: In a Direct Sequence Spread Spectrum (DSSS) system, how does the use of a spreading code affect the signal?

options.a: It compresses the signal's bandwidth
options.b: It encodes the signal with error-correcting codes
options.c: It spreads the signal over a wider frequency band
options.d: It converts the digital signal to an analog format

questions.question: Which factor is crucial in determining the minimum data rate in a communication system to avoid buffer flooding?

options.a: The size of the transmit buffer only
options.b: The processing speed of the receiver
options.c: Propagation delay and data rate
options.d: The encoding scheme used

questions.question: What is the typical outcome of using Manchester encoding in data transmission?

options.a: Reduces the bit rate
options.b: Eliminates the need for a clock signal
options.c: Ensures that there are no errors in data transmission
options.d: Provides synchronization by including transitions in each bit period

questions.question: What is the key advantage of using cyclic redundancy check (CRC) in data communication?

options.a: It provides secure encryption of data.
options.b: It ensures high data transmission speeds.
options.c: It enables reliable detection of transmission errors.
options.d: It compresses data to reduce bandwidth.

questions.question: Which method is used to calculate Hamming distance between two binary codewords?

options.a: Subtracting the number of ones in one codeword from the other
options.b: Counting the number of positions in which the corresponding bits are different
options.c: Multiplying the corresponding bits and summing the results
options.d: Adding up the total bits and dividing by the number of codewords

questions.question: In data communication, what does the term 'propagation delay' refer to?

options.a: The time it takes for a signal to be encoded onto a medium
options.b: The delay caused by error checking during transmission
options.c: The time it takes for a signal to travel from the sender to the receiver
options.d: The delay in processing data at the receiver

questions.question: What is the primary function of line encoding techniques such as NRZ-I and Manchester?

options.a: To compress the data being transmitted
options.b: To enhance the security of the transmitted data
options.c: To convert the digital data into a suitable form for transmission
options.d: To increase the data transmission rate

questions.question: What is the main benefit of using a stop-and-wait ARQ protocol in network communications?

options.a: It maximizes the throughput by sending multiple frames at once
options.b: It simplifies the flow control by allowing only one frame on the link at a time
options.c: It eliminates the need for acknowledgments
options.d: It uses less bandwidth compared to other ARQ protocols
